meanings.definition: The position of an individual in relation to others.
meanings.sent1: Her status as the team captain made her a leader among her peers.
meanings.sent2: The social status of the family was well-known in the community.
meanings.sent3: Despite his status as the youngest, he always had the best ideas.
meanings.sent4: In the hierarchy of the jungle, the lion's status as king was unquestioned.
meanings.sent5: The status of the CEO was evident in the way everyone deferred to her decisions.

meanings.definition: The condition or state of something.
meanings.sent1: The status of the project was marked as 'in progress'.
meanings.sent2: The car's status as 'out of gas' explained why it wouldn't start.
meanings.sent3: The status of the cake went from raw batter to a delicious dessert.
meanings.sent4: The status of the weather changed from sunny to stormy in a matter of minutes.
meanings.sent5: The status of the garden transformed from a barren land to a blooming paradise.

meanings.sent1: His status as a witness in the trial required him to tell the truth.
meanings.sent2: The company's status as a corporation provided certain legal protections.
meanings.sent3: The status of being a juror meant he had to listen carefully to the evidence.
meanings.sent4: The official status of the document was confirmed by the notary public.
meanings.sent5: The legal status of the contract was binding once both parties signed it.
